Field Label: Study or Project Details

All fields below can apply to Studies or Projects conducted by this Research Consortium. Studies or Projects might be non-research initiatives, or overarching projects that result in multiple Concept Sheets, or projects that have separate document and milestone tracking needs. Concept Sheets should be tracked separately in the Harmonist Hub: Concept Sheets (1) project.
Is this a Study or a Project?

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Prospective study|2, Retrospective study|3, Survey|4, Tool development|99, Other
1, Planning|2, Recruitment|3, Follow-up|6, Data collection ongoing|7, Data collection complete|8, Ended - data available|9, Ended - data not available|99, Other

Field Label:
Linked Concept Tag

(if you are using the Tags feature to label concept sheets, you can associate one tag with this project. Enter the code--not the label--of the Tag here and all Concept Sheets that have been tagged with that Tag will appear on the page for this [study_project].)
Note: These fields are available for use in REDCap only and are not currently displayed in the Hub.

This form can be used to store a few custom pieces of data associated with this study that will then be displayed on the Hub. It is best used for key information that will rarely change, like "Accrual Target" or "Total Survey Recipients". Once a study is complete, it could be used for static information like "Final Enrollment" or "Survey Response Rate." It should not be used for regularly updated data, like April Enrollment, May Enrollment, June Enrollment, etc.

Note: This is a placeholder form. It will be expanded in the future to allow collection of regular Project updates, similar to the existing Concept Update form. Content from this form is not currently displayed in the Hub.
Select up to four files to display in the Page Header "Top Files" section.

This is a repeating form. Complete one form for each study document. Study documents are displayed in a table at the bottom of the individual Study/Project page. The top four study documents can be highlighted in the "Top Files" box at the top of the page. Use the Top Files form to select the four documents to be highlighted.
